## Path3D.(constructor)

new Path3D(path, normal, raw) Creates a Path3D. A Path3D is a logical math object, so not a mesh. please read the description in the tutorial : http://doc.babylonjs.com/tutorials/How\_to\_use\_Path3D

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
constructor(
    path: Vector3[], firstNormal?: Nullable<Vector3>, raw?: boolean);
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  path | <code>Vector3[]</code> | an array of Vector3, the curve axis of the Path3D |
|  firstNormal | <code>Nullable&lt;Vector3&gt;</code> |  |
|  raw | <code>boolean</code> | (optional, default false) : boolean, if true the returned Path3D isn't normalized. Useful to depict path acceleration or speed. |
